qas.question: What year did Sviatoslav pass away?
How long did the region of Kiev dominate the State of the Rus?
What years did Vladimir the Great reign as leader?
When was the title of Grand Duke introduced?
What was not recognized after the death of Sviatoslav?
What year was the struggle between Vladimir the Great and Yaropolk I?
What region was not dominated by the state of Kievan Rus?
Where did the Grand King if Kiev control?

context: It is not clearly documented when the title of the Grand Duke was first introduced, but the <b4_0>importance of the Kiev principality<b4_0/> was recognized after the death of Sviatoslav I in <a0_0><b3_0><b5_0>972<b5_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> and the ensuing struggle between Vladimir the Great and Yaropolk I. The region of <b6_0>Kiev<b6_0/> dominated the state of Kievan Rus' for the next <a1_0>two centuries<a1_0/>. The Grand Prince ("velikiy kniaz'") of Kiev controlled the <b7_0>lands around the city<b7_0/>, and his formally subordinate relatives ruled the other cities and paid him tribute. The zenith of the state's power came during the reigns of Vladimir the Great (<a2_0>980–1015<a2_0/>) and Prince Yaroslav I the Wise (1019–1054). Both rulers continued the steady expansion of Kievan Rus' that had begun under Oleg.
